title: Used Car of the Day: 2014 Buick Regal Turbo
description: Today we bring you one of the last weird-yet-fun sedans -- a 2014 Buick Regal Turbo.
author: Tim Healey
excerpt: Today we bring you one of the last weird-yet-fun sedans -- a 2014 Buick Regal Turbo.
text: Published:  December 19th, 2024 Today we bring you one of the last weird-yet-fun sedans -- a 2014 Buick Regal Turbo. This one is, sadly, not the stick-shift version, and it has 115,000 miles on it. It's apparently in good shape and has had some work, such as a tune-up, done recently. This 2.0 turbo has apparently given the seller no trouble and has been recently rust proofed. It also has heated seats.If you're interested, you can click here to see more about this New York-state-based car.[Images: Seller]Become a TTAC insider. Tim Healey Tim Healey grew up around the auto-parts business and has always had a love for cars — his parents joke his first word was “‘Vette”. Despite this, he wanted to pursue a career in sports writing but he ended up falling semi-accidentally into the automotive-journalism industry, first at Consumer Guide Automotive and later at Web2Carz.com. He also worked as an industry analyst at Mintel Group and freelanced for About.com, CarFax, Vehix.com, High Gear Media, Torque News, FutureCar.com, Cars.com, among others, and of course Vertical Scope sites such as AutoGuide.com, Off-Road.com, and HybridCars.com. He’s an urbanite and as such, doesn’t need a daily driver, but if he had one, it would be compact, sporty, and have a manual transmission. More by Tim Healey Published December 19th, 2024 5:00 PM Comments Join the conversation 'Tis no Regal... OK if you haven't read the ad you should because its quite funny. Ohio R-title now in New York, could be Opel assembled, Ecotec, north of 100K, $59,000 I-knows-what-I-got (I realize the ask is $5,900 but it might as well be $59,000). Ohio has no real law so if it was totaled there, it was *wrecked* as it was R-title before this guy bought it which means it was 3-5yo at the time. $2,5-3, which is what the BPG dealer offered him and he scoffed saying "I can sell that for more, son!" R-title? I missed that. $6k is smoking crack. I just came here to see if Tassos was going to lose his mind over THIS particular car. Fred 2 minutes ago I looked at these brand new, it was ok. Couldn't find a manual anywhere that wasn't a GS for a lot more money. Bought an Acura Sportwagon instead, automatic and all. The only regret was it was hit from behind and totaled. Now I'm in a little Honda HR-V
html:
Published:  December 19th, 2024

Today we bring you one of the last weird-yet-fun sedans -- a 2014 Buick Regal Turbo.

This one is, sadly, not the stick-shift version, and it has 115,000 miles on it. It's apparently in good shape and has had some work, such as a tune-up, done recently.

This 2.0 turbo has apparently given the seller no trouble and has been recently rust proofed. It also has heated seats.

If you're interested, you can click here to see more about this New York-state-based car.

[Images: Seller]

Become a TTAC insider. Get the latest news, features, TTAC takes, and everything else that gets to the truth about cars first by  subscribing to our newsletter.

Tim Healey

Tim Healey grew up around the auto-parts business and has always had a love for cars — his parents joke his first word was “‘Vette”. Despite this, he wanted to pursue a career in sports writing but he ended up falling semi-accidentally into the automotive-journalism industry, first at Consumer Guide Automotive and later at Web2Carz.com. He also worked as an industry analyst at Mintel Group and freelanced for About.com, CarFax, Vehix.com, High Gear Media, Torque News, FutureCar.com, Cars.com, among others, and of course Vertical Scope sites such as AutoGuide.com, Off-Road.com, and HybridCars.com. He’s an urbanite and as such, doesn’t need a daily driver, but if he had one, it would be compact, sporty, and have a manual transmission.

More by Tim Healey

Published

December 19th, 2024 5:00 PM

Comments
Join the conversation

  • 'Tis no Regal... OK if you haven't read the ad you should because its quite funny. Ohio R-title now in New York, could be Opel assembled, Ecotec, north of 100K, $59,000 I-knows-what-I-got (I realize the ask is $5,900 but it might as well be $59,000). Ohio has no real law so if it was totaled there, it was *wrecked* as it was R-title before this guy bought it which means it was 3-5yo at the time. $2,5-3, which is what the BPG dealer offered him and he scoffed saying "I can sell that for more, son!"

    • R-title? I missed that. $6k is smoking crack.

  • I just came here to see if Tassos was going to lose his mind over THIS particular car.

  • Fred 2 minutes ago

    I looked at these brand new, it was ok. Couldn't find a manual anywhere that wasn't a GS for a lot more money. Bought an Acura Sportwagon instead, automatic and all. The only regret was it was hit from behind and totaled. Now I'm in a little Honda HR-V
